Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Rejection \Re*jec"tion\ (r?-j?k"sh?n), n. [L. rejectio: cf. F. r['e]jection.] Act of rejecting, or state of being rejected. [1913 Webster]

rejection n 1: the act of rejecting something; "his proposals were met with rejection" 2: the state of being rejected [ant: {acceptance}] 3: (medicine) an immunological response that refuses to accept substances or organisms that are recognized as foreign; "rejection of the transplanted liver" 4: the speech act of rejecting
